title: Trista and Ryan Sutter's 2 Kids Look All Grown Up on the First Day of Junior and Senior Year
description: "It just goes too fast," Trista wrote in her caption
content:
NEED TO KNOW
• None Trista and Ryan Sutter's two kids are almost all grown up
• None The two celebrated their first day of junior and senior year
• None Trista said that time "just goes too fast" as she included a Reel of photos of her kids' first days of school

Trista and Ryan Sutter's kids are (almost) all grown up!

The mom of two, 52, shared an emotional video on Instagram on Thursday, Aug. 14 as she celebrated her daughter Blakeley's first day of junior year and her son Maxwell's first day of senior year. Trista included photos of her kids' first days of school throughout the year, starting in kindergarten and ending with a sweet clip of the two together.

"It just goes too fast. 🥹," Trista wrote in her caption. "Junior year for Blakesley Grace and the last, first day for our senior (what?!!! 😭), Maxwell Alston."



"I love you both to the moon and back to the moon and back to the moon and back to infinity and beyond and I cannot wait to see what this year has in store for you both (but I’m putting in a request for time to slow down. 🙏🏼)," she said.

Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.

Trista and her husband Ryan got engaged in 2003 during the finale episode of Trista's Bachelorette season. They went on to welcome son Maxwell in 2007 and daughter Blakeley in 2009.

Last August, the former Bachelorette star told her followers that some parents demonstrate her "biggest pet peeve" while supporting their kids at sporting events.

As she revealed that her son Max has hockey games scheduled all weekend, and she will spend the Labor Day holiday cheering him on from the bleachers, Trista took the opportunity to share something that bothers her about other parents at kids' sports events.

"One of my biggest pet peeves is each game there's a home team and an away team," Trista explained. "I always sit on whichever team our team is on. So if they're the home team for that game I sit on the home side, if they're the away team then I sit on the away side."

"Seems easy, right?" the mom-of-two said, before venting about how not every parent shares this logic.

"But there are parents that just don't feel the same and they sit on whatever side they want, and it drives me nuts," Trista continued. "I'm like, 'Why can't you sit on your team's side?'"

"Does this drive anyone else crazy, or am I just loopy and have nothing else better to do?" she said with a laugh, adding a question box for her followers to respond.

That previous April, Trista shared a carousel of images on Easter Sunday, in which she posed alongside her family of four. In other images, the couple could be seen with extended family members at a church service, and in one, just Trista and Ryan posed for a selfie in the sun.

"Thankful for the gifts of life and love, family near and far, friends new and old, and moments of connection and joy," Trista captioned the images. "Happy Easter!"
summary: Trista and Ryan Sutter's two children, Blakeley and Maxwell, celebrated their first day of junior and senior year with a video on Instagram. The mother-of-two included a Reel of photos of her kids' first days of school and asked her followers to slow down as time "just goes too fast." She also shared her frustrations about other parents' decisions to sit on different sides at children's sports events. The couple got engaged in 2003 and welcomed their children in 2007 and 2009.
shortSummary: Trista and Ryan Sutter's two children are nearly all grown up, celebrating their first days in junior and senior year, while addressing social media etiquette.

Credit : Trista Sutter/Instagram Trista Sutter is choosing sides. On her Instagram Stories on Saturday, Aug. 31, the former Bachelorette star, 51, told her followers that some parents demonstrate her "biggest pet peeve" while supporting their kids at sporting events. She said her 17-year-old son, Max, has hockey games scheduled all weekend, and she will spend the Labor Day holiday cheering him on from the bleachers. Trista took the opportunity to share something that bothers her about other parents at kids' sports events. Trista and husband Ryan Sutter — who got engaged in 2003 during the finale episode of Trista's Bachelorette season — also share a 15-year-old daughter named Blakesley. When she is not at the rink supporting her son Max, Trista is a proud dance mom. She took Blakesley to The Dance Awards in Las Vegas in June before celebrating Max's birthday in July. Trista and Ryan Sutter with daughter Blakesley and son Max. Trista Sutter/Instagram "Today marks 17 years of a pride I had never known before…and it just continues to grow. ❤️. Happy birthday @max.sutter_21," the reality star captioned a photo set featuring both of her kids on Instagram on July 27. "I hope your heart of hearts is forever filled with the knowledge that you are seen, appreciated and loved. ILY more," Trista added. Trista and Ryan Sutter Are Feeling 'Thankful' as They Celebrate Easter with Their Kids and Extended Family The family is celebrating their first Easter since their big move By Angela Andaloro Angela Andaloro Angela Andaloro is a Society & Culture Staff Writer at PEOPLE. She has been working at PEOPLE since 2022. Her work has previously appeared on BuzzFeed, Entertainment Weekly, and LittleThings. People Editorial Guidelines Updated on April 1, 2024 04:54PM EDT Leave a Comment Trista and Ryan Sutter Celebrate Easter with Their Kids. Credit : Trista Sutter/Instagram Trista Sutter is enjoying special moments with her family of four. The former Bachelorette, 51, shared a carousel of images on Easter Sunday, in which she posed alongside husband Ryan Sutter, 49, and their children: daughter, Blakesley, 14, and son Maxwell, 15. In other images, the couple could be seen with extended family members at a church service, and in one, just Trista and Ryan posed for a selfie in the sun. "Happy Easter!" The original Bachelorette couple kicked off this year by attending the Golden Bachelor wedding of Gerry Turner and Theresa Nist, posing with their two plus ones in a rare full-family appearance. The sweet family photo showed the Sutters dressed up and ready to celebrate the special day. Blakesley wore a pink halter dress and posed next to Trista, who chose an off-the-shoulder black dress. Maxwell stood behind his mom, wearing a black suit and white tie, while Ryan posed in front, wearing a navy suit and burgundy tie. Trista and Ryan Sutter at church on Easter 2024 with their family and friends. Ryan Sutter Says He Still Can't Watch Wife Trista's Season of The Bachelorette — 17 Years Later The father of two says it's "always been really uncomfortable for me" By Aurelie Corinthios Published on July 7, 2020 10:26AM EDT Almost two decades later, Ryan Sutter still hasn't been able to watch his love story with wife Trista unfold on The Bachelorette. Fresh off of being dumped by the original Bachelor Alex Michel, Trista (then Trista Rehn) became the first Bachelorette in 2003. It was there that she met and fell in love with Ryan, a firefighter. The two got married in a televised ceremony in December 2003. Seventeen years later, they're still together and live in Colorado with their son Max, 12, and daughter Blakesley, 11. After Monday's episode of ABC's retrospective series, The Bachelor: The Greatest Seasons — Ever!, looked back on their journey, the couple made a virtual appearance on Good Morning America on Tuesday. Eugene Gologursky/Getty The Bachelor and Bachelorette Couples — Who Made Their Love Last? Trista, 47, said she remains "very, very, very grateful" that Michel didn't choose her. But despite their success story, Ryan, 45, admitted he still can't watch his wife's season of the show. "Always been really uncomfortable for me," he said. "First of all, I don't like watching myself on television. I also don't like watching my wife kiss other guys on TV, so." The couple also revealed that their kids are starting to get an inkling of who their parents are. "I remember Blakesley, one time, she was like, 'Are we famous?'" Ryan recalled. "And you're trying to explain to her that people know who you are, but we're not really famous." As for the future of the franchise? Both are looking forward to Clare Crawley's upcoming season of The Bachelorette, followed by Matt James' debut as the first black Bachelor. "I'm really excited," Trista said. "It's about time. I am in full support of more diversity in The Bachelor and The Bachelorette — the whole franchise." And Crawley is the "perfect lead," she added. "There are still people out there who want to jump to judgment about why a woman would do this," she said. "I think that Clare is the perfect lead because she's really strong an intelligent, and she's going to fight for what she deserves." The Bachelor: The Greatest Seasons — Ever! returns July 20 at 8 p.m. ET on ABC. Read more: Entertainment TV Reality TV

argos_summary: Former "Bachelorette" star Trista Sutter posted an emotional Instagram Reel on Aug. 14 celebrating her daughter Blakeley's first day of junior year and son Maxwell's first day of senior year, reflecting on how quickly time passes. The clip compiled photos from their first days of school each year, ending with a sweet moment of the siblings together. Sutter also shared a pet‑peeve about parents at kids' sports games, insisting they sit on their team’s side, and has previously posted family photos for Easter and other milestones. The article highlights her gratitude for family and her ongoing engagement with fans through social media.
